intro: Cryptandra billardierei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, woody shrub form. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Cryptandra billardierei is valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife and its potential for use in horticulture.
